title: Motivation & Drive
description: Discover what motivates each of you and how you fuel each other's ambitions.

questions.text: What motivates me most in life is...
choices: Making a difference or having impact
Learning, growing, and improving
Security and providing for those I love
Freedom and experiencing life fully

therapeutic.rationale: Core motivations reveal what drives us at the deepest level. Impact-seekers want significance; growth-seekers want development; security-seekers want stability; freedom-seekers want experience. Understanding your partner's core motivation helps you support what matters most.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different core motivations are common and complementary. The security-seeker and freedom-seeker may need to balance stability and adventure.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared core motivations create aligned life direction and mutual understanding of priorities.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What motivates you most deeply in life? Does your partner understand this about you?

questions.text: When I feel unmotivated, what helps most is...
choices: Remembering why it matters
Breaking things into smaller steps
Encouragement and belief from you
Taking a break and coming back fresh

therapeutic.rationale: Motivation recovery strategies vary. Purpose-rememberers reconnect to meaning; step-breakers reduce overwhelm; encouragement-needers need external support; break-takers need rest. Knowing what helps your partner refuel allows targeted support.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different recovery strategies require flexibility. What helps you may not help your partner. Ask what they actually need.
therapeutic.whenSame: Matched recovery strategies make helping each other regain motivation intuitive.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What helps you when you're feeling unmotivated? Have you told your partner?

questions.text: You help fuel my motivation by...
choices: Believing in me even when I doubt myself
Celebrating my progress along the way
Giving me space to pursue what matters
Being a partner who inspires me

therapeutic.rationale: How partners fuel motivation reveals support needs. Belief provides confidence; celebration provides acknowledgment; space provides autonomy; inspiration provides modeling. Understanding your role in your partner's motivation helps you play it well.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different motivation fuel needs require learning what actually helps your partner. Your natural offering may not match their need.
therapeutic.whenSame: Matched motivation fuel creates natural synergy in supporting each other's drive.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: How does your partner fuel your motivation? Have you told them what helps most?

questions.text: When it comes to ambition, I...
choices: Have clear goals I'm working toward
Am still figuring out what I want
Balance ambition with contentment
Care more about purpose than achievement

therapeutic.rationale: Relationships with ambition vary. Goal-havers have clarity; figure-outers are exploring; balancers value both striving and being; purpose-seekers prioritize meaning over metrics. No approach is betterâ€”what matters is understanding your partner's orientation.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different ambition orientations can complement or create tension. The goal-haver and contentment-balancer may need to find middle ground.
therapeutic.whenSame: Matched ambition orientations create aligned approach to striving and success.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What's your relationship with ambition? How does it affect your relationship with your partner?

questions.text: I believe supporting each other's ambitions means...
choices: Making sacrifices when needed for each other's goals
Encouraging without pushing
Creating space for individual pursuits
Aligning our ambitions toward shared dreams

therapeutic.rationale: Beliefs about ambition support shape how couples navigate individual goals. Sacrifice-makers prioritize partner goals; encouragers provide emotional support; space-creators protect autonomy; aligners seek shared direction. All approaches have merit.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different support philosophies require conversation about expectations. The sacrifice-maker may feel unreciprocated by the space-creator.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared support philosophy creates clear expectations for how you'll navigate each other's ambitions.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What does supporting each other's ambitions mean to you? Are you getting and giving that support?
